t: Amos 5
A Lament for Israel
Hear*p this word which I take up against you, a lamentation, O house of Israel:
The*pn virgin of Israel has fallen; She*ld will rise no more. She*ld lies forsaken on her land; There*ild is*i no one to raise her up.
For*p thus says the Lord God:*s “The*pn city that goes out by a thousand Shall*ld have a hundred left, And*ld that which goes out by a hundred Shall*ld have ten left to the house of Israel.”
A Call to Repentance
For*p thus says the Lord*s to the house of Israel: “Seek*pn Me and live;
But*ld do not seek Bethel, Nor*ld enter Gilgal, Nor*ld pass over to Beersheba; For*ld Gilgal shall surely go into captivity, And*ld Bethel shall come to nothing.
Seek*ld the Lord*s and live, Lest*ld He break out like fire in*i the house of Joseph, And*ld devour it,*i With*ld no one to quench it*i in Bethel—
You*ld who turn justice to wormwood, And*ld lay righteousness to rest in the earth!”

He*ln made the Pleiades and Orion; He*ld turns the shadow of death into morning And*ld makes the day dark as night; He*ld calls for the waters of the sea And*ld pours them out on the face of the earth; The*ld Lord*s is*i His name.
He*ld rains ruin upon the strong, So*ld that fury comes upon the fortress.
They*ln hate the one who rebukes in the gate, And*ld they abhor the one who speaks uprightly.

Therefore,*ld because you tread down the poor And*ld take grain taxes from him, Though*ld you have built houses of hewn stone, Yet*ld you shall not dwell in them; You*ld have planted pleasant vineyards, But*ld you shall not drink wine from them.
For*ld I know your manifold transgressions And*ld your mighty sins: Afflicting*ld the just and*i taking bribes; Diverting*ld the poor from*i justice*i at the gate.
Therefore*ld the prudent keep silent at that time, For*ld it is*i an evil time.
Seek*ln good and not evil, That*ld you may live; So*ld the Lord*s God of hosts will be with you, As*ld you have spoken.
Hate*ld evil, love good; Establish*ld justice in the gate. It*ld may be that the Lord*s God of hosts Will*ld be gracious to the remnant of Joseph.
The Day of the Lord

Therefore*p the Lord*s God of hosts, the Lord, says this: “There*ipn shall*i be*i wailing in all streets, And*ld they shall say in all the highways, ‘Alas!*ld Alas!’ They*ld shall call the farmer to mourning, And*ld skillful lamenters to wailing.
In*ld all vineyards there*i shall*i be*i wailing, For*ld I will pass through you,” Says*ld the Lord.*s
Woe*ln to you who desire the day of the Lord!*s For*ld what good is*i the day of the Lord*s to you? It*ld will*i be*i darkness, and not light.
It*ld will*i be*i as though a man fled from a lion, And*ld a bear met him! Or*ld as*i though*i he went into the house, Leaned*ld his hand on the wall, And*ld a serpent bit him!
Is*ild not the day of the Lord*s darkness, and not light? Is*ild it*i not*i very dark, with no brightness in it?
“I*ln hate, I despise your feast days, And*ld I do not savor your sacred assemblies.
Though*ld you offer Me burnt offerings and your grain offerings, I*ld will not accept them,*i Nor*ld will I regard your fattened peace offerings.
Take*ld away from Me the noise of your songs, For*ld I will not hear the melody of your stringed instruments.
But*ld let justice run down like water, And*ld righteousness like a mighty stream.
“Did*ln you offer Me sacrifices and offerings In*ld the wilderness forty years, O house of Israel?
You*ld also carried Sikkuth your king And*ld Chiun, your idols, The*ld star of your gods, Which*ld you made for yourselves.
Therefore*ld I will send you into captivity beyond Damascus,” Says*ld the Lord,*s whose name is*i the God of hosts.
